Title: Producer - Contractor (Remote working)
Content:
CCP London is currently growing our team! We have an exciting opportunity for a talented Contractor Producer to work with us online on an unannounced multiplayer shooter. We are looking for an individual with strong project management skills to join a highly motivated team of programmers, artists, designers, and QA working to build a varied and unique user experience for the game.

In this work from home era, we have found increasing success working with partners from a wide variety of disciplines. We believe that a talented, self-motivated Producer can help us review the game, help us identify short comings, and work with discipline leads to prioritize new features. In this role in particular, we are flexible and can accomodate candidates that work outside the UK and EU (remote working), so anyone who has the experience and is able to work on our schedule will be considered.

We are a small team in the early stages of development, so this is a unique opportunity to have a large impact. Reporting to the Game Director you will be responsible for all aspects of production. As a Producer, you will use a blend of creative, technical, and management experience to lead the team to deliver in all areas of the development process. You will develop and grow the competencies of the current production team towards our AAA vision.

Requirements of the contract:

Provide feedback on all features and assess whether the work is doneWork with our other full-time production staff to establish the roadmap, budget, and resource plans for a key area of the gameSuggest improvements to our Agile development processCollaborate with cross-discipline teams to create clear plans and help scope the projectDrive teams to deliver on-time & on-budget results at AAA qualityMaintain clear documentation on sprint goalsWork with QA and design to prioritise bug fixes and tuningIdentify and mitigate risks early and communicate them clearlyManage end of sprint reporting and take a key role in process improvementManage the process and structure of the functional teamsEnsure all team members have the resources they need and resolve bottlenecks before they arise

Your profile:

Have your own computer and internet, capable of playing modern PC games, and willing to work from homeAble to work near our core hours of 10:00-16:00 UTCSolid experience in game production, PC and console preferred. Shipped multiple AAA titlesExperience using Jira and ConfluenceAbility to create schedules, monitor, and update progressOrganisational skills are your superpowerExperience working in an Agile development environment, specifically with SCRUM teamsOutsourcing experience

Desirable Skills:

Experience with UE4Familiarity with the EVE universeRelevant University educationPrior experience working as a Producer with a dev team
